alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 5:19AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Albany and east central Schoharie Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 519 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Livingstonville, or 16 miles southeast of Cobleskill, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Delmar, Westerlo, Berne, Voorheesville, Middleburgh, Livingstonville, Feura Bush, New Scotland, Rensselaerville, Clarksville, East Berne, Slingerlands, Shoefelt Corners, South Albany, West Berne, Huntersland, Spawn Hollow, Dormansville, Callanans Corners and Karlsfeld. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
